intro: Matelea variifolia, commonly known as the variable matelea, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family, which includes milkweeds and related species. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink and yellow. It typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Matelea variifolia is often found in desert and chaparral habitats, where it plays a role in supporting local pollinators.
